body.p: Template document for creating the ELTeC Library

div.head: Full formal specifications
div.p: The ELTeC encoding scheme defined by this document is a TEI-conformant customization, from which user documentation, and formal RELAXNG or DTD specifications can be generated automatically.

This section contains the full schema specification from which other level-specific versions are subsequently derived. It must be converted using teitoodd to produce the compiled ODD eltec-compiled.xml which is used as a basis for the others.

moduleRef.include: author bibl choice corr orig date emph foreign gap head hi item l label lg list measure milestone name note p pb publisher pubPlace quote ref relatedItem resp respStmt rs sp stage hi term title
TEI text div body front back trailer
availability change encodingDesc extent fileDesc idno keywords langUsage language licence profileDesc publicationStmt revisionDesc sourceDesc teiHeader titleStmt

exemplum.p: adds a reference for a standard authority database, e.g. viaf

constraint.assert: provide a title for each novel followed by the phrase "ELTeC edition" (or a similar expression in the language of the text)

exemplum.p: describes the a title of a novel and the edition in which it is included
specifies the title of novel using ref attribute to reference an authority file entry for the title; in this case in VIAF

titleStmt.title: El SeÃ±or de Bembibre : ediciÃ³n ELTeC

licence.p: The TEI mark up is licenced with Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY 4.0).

exemplum.p: In an ELTeC text, the publication statement always contains a statement concerning its licence, and is always followed by statement of the date the text was added to the Collection. These statements are always given in the language of the text itself; in this case, English.

licence.p: El documento TEI estÃ¡ licenciado con Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY 4.0).

exemplum.p: In this case, the publication statement concerns a Spanish text.

valItem.desc: describes the first complete print source edition published in the author's lifetime
describes a print source edition used as the source of the encoding which is not the first edition
describes a digital edition used as the source of the encoding, which may be derived from the first or another print edition

exemplum.p: shows a full source description with a digital source which represents the first edition

bibl.title: Opera omnia
Romanzi
bibl.author: Svevo, Italo
bibl.note: Contiene: Una vita ; Senilita ; La coscienza di Zeno

exemplum.p: The ELTeC text derives from a print edition published in 1969. The first edition of the work concerned was published in 1892. We do not know whether or not the print edition used the first edition as a source, and therefore we do not provide an explicit relatedItem.
describes the level of encoding of the TEI document, either level 0, 1 or 2
This text in the Spanish language has the identifier SPA2001

remarks.p: In ELTeC schemas, the attributes xml:lang and xml:id must be supplied for each TEI element. Identifiers should have a common alphabetic prefix followed by up to 5 digits. Language codes should conform to ISO 639-2

publicationStmt.p: Adicionado Ã coleÃ§Ã£o ELTeC 20 de novembro de 2018.

elementSpec.desc: specifies the sex of the author where this is known

valItem.desc: male author
female author
author sex unknown
author sex mixed

remarks.p: indicates the biological sex of the author, not the sex claimed or implied by the author's name

exemplum.p: indicates that the author of the novel to be described is male (M)
indicates that the gender of author of the novel to be described cannot be specified (U)

elementSpec.desc: indicates the size group to which the text belongs

valItem.desc: more than 100,000 words

exemplum.p: indicates that a novel contains more than 100,00 words (long)

elementSpec.desc: indicates the degree to which the text has become part of a literary canon

valItem.desc: text has been republished very frequently since its original appearance
text has been republished occasionally since its original appearance
text has not been reprinted since its original appearance

remarks.p: Frequency of publication is assessed with reference to time periods of twenty years. A work which has been republished in more than four such periods, i.e. over a reasonably long time since its first appearance, is considered highly canonical. A work which appears to have been published only in a single such period is considered of low canonicity.

elementSpec.desc: specifies the time period during which the work was first published as a single volume

valItem.desc: work first published between 1840 and 1859
work first published between 1860 and 1879
work first published between 1880 and 1899
work first published between 1900 and 1920

exemplum.p: indicates that the novel to be described was published for the first between 1840 and 1859 (T1)
Profile for a French text, with a male author, containing more than 100,000 words, of medium canonicity, first published between 1840 and 1859.
Profile for a German text, with a female author, containing between 10 and 50,000 words, of medium canonicity, first published between 1900 and 1920.
Profile for a text with a female author, containing between over 100,000 words, of high canonicity, first published between 1860 and 1879.

remarks.p: The elements authorGender, size, canonicity, and timeSlot are not TEI elements, and do not belong to the TEI namespace. Their namespace must be specified, either in full as in this example, or by means of a namespace prefix defined on some hierarchically superior element.
Each of these four elements must be supplied exactly once, and in the order specified.

exemplum.p: describes an example for titleStmt including title and author, author gets an optional viaf reference

titleStmt.title: Silas Marner: The Weaver of Raveloe : ELTec edition
titleStmt.author: Eliot, George (pseud.) (1819-1880)

exemplum.p: describes a Spanish example for titleStmt including title and author both having optional viaf references provided by ref.

exemplum.p: provides different measurements for length

valItem.desc: refers to pages in the source text
approximates the number of space delimited tokens in source text
refers to the number of volumes for original source text

exemplum.p: describes two measurements for extent: the number of words and the number of pages

remarks.p: An indication of the number of words is mandatory. Indicating the number of pages is optional. If information for page or volume count is not available the relevant measure element should be absent.
Spaces and other punctuation marks are not permitted as content of the measure element.

exemplum.p: provides information about the changes in the document, showing an example of the revision description (revisonDesc)

exemplum.p: provides the information about changes (change in a document

valItem.desc: title page transcription (level 1 only)
collects authorial notes (level 1 only)
authorial preface, foreword, back matter etc.
any textual division which is not further sub-divided except by milestone markers and which contains one or more paragraphs
a textual division containing one or more paragraphs and not further sub-divided except by milestone markers which is presented as a letter
any grouping of chapters or groups, e.g. part, volume, etc.

div.head: III
div.p: Em casa do dr. Carvalho, Claudio pouco fallou com Emilia, elle prezo a uma meza do "whist", para ser agradavel ao juiz que sem isso se aborrecia, ella dansando sempre. ...

remarks.p: A division of type=letter should only be used if the entire novel is composed of a sequence of letters. When a letter is quoted within a chapter containing other material, the letter should be marked using the quote element.

licence.p: The TEI mark up is licenced with Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY 4.0).

Paris: Furne, J.-J. Dubochet et Cie, J. Hetzel et Paulin, 1848.

revisionDesc.change: Conversion with CLIGStoELTeC stylesheet for ELTeC-1

exemplum.p: When used within a titleStmt, an author's name is given in a standardized format (surname, forename/s, (YYYY-YYYY)) as shown in this example.
When used within the sourceDesc, an author's name is given in the format used by the source in question, as shown in this example.
In cases of multiple authorship, the author element within titleStmt should be repeated

titleStmt.title: The Diary of a Nobody : ELTeC edition
titleStmt.author: Grossmith, George (1847-1912)
Grossmith, Walter Weedon (1854-1919)

remarks.p: The ref attribute should be used to reference one or more externally defined identifiers for the author, as defined by an authority file such as VIAF.

attDef.desc: link to a graphic image of the page beginning here

exemplum.p: A page break may be associated with a facsimile image of the page it introduces by means of the facs attribute
If a page break interrupts a word the word fragments should be reassembled following it.

egXML.p:
My own relations too were nobly generous and by their kindness I have been
established in this shop, and for the last year have carried on this little business....

remarks.p: A pb element should appear at the start of the page which it identifies. The global n attribute indicates the number or other value associated with this page. This will normally be the page number or signature printed on it, since the physical sequence number is implicit in the presence of the pb element itself.

div.head: BOOK THE FIRST
THE DAYS BEFORE TONO-BUNGAY WAS INVENTED
CHAPTER THE FIRST
div.p: Most people in this world seem to live "in character" ...
....of an altogether different sort from that of Tono-Bungay.
I write that much and look at it, and wonder ...

exemplum.p: Two consecutive graphic components omitted from transcription:
Table of contents omitted from transcription:

div.p: .... and to think of the money it cost!

egXML.p: April 5.-Two shoulders of mutton arrived, Carrie having arranged with another butcher without consulting me. Gowing called, and fell over scraper coming in. Must get that scraper removed.
April 6.-Eggs for breakfast simply shocking; sent them back to Borset with my compliments, and he needn't call any more for orders.

indication the date of the first edition of a novel within bibl

remarks.p: date is used within publicationStmt and within bibl.

exemplum.p: indicates that the digital source described by the outer bibl element is related to the first edition described by the inner bibl element.

remarks.p: In ELTeC this element is used only as a child element of bibl, as shown in this example.

exemplum.p: describes the person responsible for the ELTeC edition of a novel which will be stated in titleStmt
contains information about every source of the novel in the ELTeC edition

div.head: CHAPTER I.
div.quote: Since I can do no good because a woman, Reach constantly at something that is near it. â€”The Maid's Tragedy: BEAUMONT AND FLETCHER.
div.p: Miss Brooke had that kind of beauty which seems to be thrown into relief by poor dress....

exemplum.p: A heading of any kind at the start of a division of any kind may be marked using head. In this example, there are two headings at the start of the first part, and one at the start of the first chapter. The epigraph at the start of the first chapter is marked up as a quotation and is not a heading.

remarks.p: This element is used at level0 for any kind of typographic salience recorded by the encoder. At level1 a semantic interpretation (for example using emph, foreign etc. replaces it.
